name: Hu Tao
title: Fragrance in Thaw
description: The 77th Director of the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor. She took over the business at a rather young age.

normal.1: Performs up to 6 consecutive spear strikes.

charged.1: Consumes a certain amount of Stamina to lunge forward, dealing damage to opponents along the way.

plunging.1: Plunges from mid-air to strike the ground below, damaging opponents along the path and dealing AoE DMG upon impact.

description.0: Only an unwavering flame can cleanse the impurities of this world.
description.1: Hu Tao consumes a set portion of her HP to knock the surrounding enemies back and enter the Paramita Papilio state.
4: Increases Hu Tao's ATK based on her Max HP at the time of entering this state. ATK Bonus gained this way cannot exceed 400% of Hu Tao's Base ATK.
Converts attack DMG to <pyro>Pyro DMG</pyro>, which cannot be overridden by any other elemental infusion.
Charged Attacks apply the Blood Blossom effect to the enemies hit.
Increases Hu Tao's resistance to interruption.
description.7: Enemies affected by Blood Blossom will take <pyro>Pyro DMG</pyro> every 4s. This DMG is considered Elemental Skill DMG.
description.8: Each enemy can be affected by only one Blood Blossom effect at a time, and its duration may only be refreshed by Hu Tao herself.
description.10: Paramita Papilio ends when its duration is over, or Hu Tao has left the battlefield or fallen.
description.12: Hu Tao's Secret Spear technique is based on several rules, the first of which is: "The spear opens the path to the afterlife, and the butterflies bridge this world and the next."

description.0: Commands a blazing spirit to attack, dealing <pyro>Pyro DMG</pyro> in a large AoE.
description.1: Upon striking the enemy, regenerates a percentage of Hu Tao's Max HP. This effect can be triggered up to 5 times, based on the number of enemies hit.
description.2: If Hu Tao's HP is below or equal to 50% when the enemy is hit, both the DMG and HP Regeneration are increased.
description.4: Supernatural activity by those who have already left this world is a source of great anxiety for the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor. In such cases, cremation always lets Hu Tao find peace of mind. The more anxious she feels, the stronger the flame.

description.0: When a Paramita Papilio state activated by Guide to Afterlife ends, all allies in the party (excluding Hu Tao herself) will have their CRIT Rate increased by 12% for 8s.
When Hu Tao's HP is equal to or less than 50%, her <pyro>Pyro DMG Bonus</pyro> is increased by 33%.
When Hu Tao cooks a dish perfectly, she has a 18% chance to receive an additional "Suspicious" dish of the same type.
While in a Paramita Papilio state activated by Guide to Afterlife, Hu Tao's Charged Attacks do not consume Stamina.
Increases the Blood Blossom DMG by an amount equal to 10% of Hu Tao's Max HP at the time the effect is applied.
description.1: Additionally, Spirit Soother will also apply the Blood Blossom effect.

description.0: Increases the Level of Guide to Afterlife by 3.
Upon defeating an enemy affected by a Blood Blossom that Hu Tao applied herself, all nearby allies in the party (excluding Hu Tao herself) will have their CRIT Rate increased by 12% for 15s.
Increases the Level of Spirit Soother by 3.
Triggers when Hu Tao's HP drops below 25%, or when she suffers a lethal strike:
description.1: Hu Tao will not fall as a result of the DMG sustained. Additionally, for the next 10s, her All Elemental and Physical RES is increased by 200%, her CRIT Rate is increased by 100%, and her resistance to interruption is greatly increased.
description.2: This effect triggers automatically when Hu Tao has 1 HP left.
